page.title: 15FLORA AND FAUNA
page.content: The{birds}commonly seen in our area are Dippers,Seagulls and Wagtails. Sometimes seen are Herons,Wild Ducks and Goosanders.Other birds are Sparrows,Hedge Sparrows,Crows,Rooks, Jackdaws,Kestrels,Sparrow Hawks(Once rare but increasing in numbers) Blackheaded Gulls,Chaffinches, Goldfinches.In spring Curlews visit as do Swallows,Swifts,House Martins and various Wablers,Cuckoos are rare. Dippers are common in our area and are frequently seen by the Tees.Its nickname is the waiter because of its white bib and black overcoat.It is 18cm high and like a large Wren.It lays 5 white eggs near the water into which it dives to find its food of small water creatures.
